forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Partly cloudy, with a low around 52. West northwest wind 5 to 10 mph.

forecast.name: Friday
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain after 5pm. Partly sunny. High near 62, with temperatures falling to around 60 in the afternoon. West southwest wind 2 to 13 mph, with gusts as high as 18 mph. Chance of precipitation is 80%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

weather_report:
As the evening settles over Downtown San Francisco, a gentle calm begins to blanket the city, with temperatures hovering comfortably in the low 50s. The air carries the subtle hint of moisture, a reminder of the rain that promises to grace the skies tomorrow. Tonight, the clouds are delicately woven, parting just enough to allow for glimmers of city lights to punctuate the darkness, while a light west-northwest breeze stirs the atmosphere—a whisper of what lies ahead.

Looking toward tomorrow, anticipation builds as the forecast hints at a change in the mood. The day will offer a transient charm of partly sunny skies, teasing at warmth that will soon dip with the fading sun. Rain trickles in after five, painting the day with an 80% chance of gentle drizzles, the kind that urges one to enjoy a cozy retreat indoors. Given the forecast, layers will be your ally; a light sweater or jacket will keep you snug as the chill deepens. A walk down to the waterfront might reveal the beauty of a misty horizon, perfect for contemplating the interplay of land and sea. Otherwise, a quiet afternoon spent in a corner café, perhaps with a novel in hand, could meld well with the rhythm of raindrops punctuating the air—a simple pleasure to embrace as October draws to a close.
